function_call.name: classify_risks_framework
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Negative association between forest and infection rates","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Influence of urbanicity levels on forest-infection rate association","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Impact of distance between forest and human settlements on infection rates","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Association between green space and infection rates","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Positive association of developed open space with infection rates","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Variations in green space-infection associations across levels of urbanicity","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Conducting multiple regression models may lead to the risk of overfitting and misleading results due to the large number of predictor variables.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Assessing the association of forest with infection rates across different time periods and urbanicity levels may overlook other important factors contributing to disease propagation.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Examining the optimal distance from forest for its association with infection rates may neglect the impact of other environmental and social determinants of health in disease transmission.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Potential bias in the classification of urban-rural levels based on outdated scheme","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Exclusion of confounding factors with vif \textbackslashu003e= 4 may lead to incomplete understanding of the impact of green space factors on infection rates","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Proximity to forest increasing infection rate","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Local park area as a potential transmission hotspot","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Population-weighted forest exposure and infection rates","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Incomplete infection data at the county level","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"The study focuses on the relationship between green spaces and sars-cov-2 infection rates, which may oversimplify the complex factors contributing to disease transmission.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"The study assesses the impact of green spaces on sars-cov-2 infection rates, but other environmental factors and behaviors may also contribute to disease transmission.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"The study explores the relationship between green spaces and sars-cov-2 infection rates, but lacks consideration of disparities in access to green spaces and healthcare resources.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Unknown relationship between green spaces and sars-cov-2 infection rates","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Inconclusive findings from existing studies","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Short study periods and exclusion of confounding factors","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of consideration for green spaces as a mitigating factor for sars-cov-2 infection","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limited data on the relationship between green spaces and infection rates across multiple waves of the pandemic","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Uncertainty about the characteristics and optimal buffer distance of green space exposure for reducing sars-cov-2 infection rates","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Failure to implement frequent handwashing and barrier measures","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of structured programme for instruction and education on public health measures","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Inadequate isolation of people with suspected respiratory tract infections","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of compliance with low-cost interventions","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Ineffective evaluation of global and resource-intensive measures","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Limited capability for long-term maintenance of strict hygiene and barrier routines","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Limited evidence for the effectiveness of barrier devices like n95 masks over simple surgical masks.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Confounding additional routines may affect the interpretation of the effectiveness of interventions such as adding virucidals or antiseptics to normal handwashing.","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"High transmission of respiratory viruses among younger children","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Potential for confounding in studies evaluating reduced transmission of respiratory viruses","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"High transmission of sars epidemic in china, singapore, and vietnam in 2003","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Inadequate blinding or adjustment for confounders in study design","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Inappropriate interventions and comparison causing problems with study designs","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Compliance issues with interventions, especially educational programmes","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Incomplete or no reporting of key data randomisation, blinding, numerators and denominators, interventions, outcomes, attrition of participants, confidence intervals, cluster coefficients .","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Confusion between cohort design and before-and-after design, leading to unsupported conclusions.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Potential biases such as cash incentives given to participants.","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inadequate randomisation in randomised studies leading to biased results.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Presence of potential confounders in non-randomised studies affecting the accuracy of results.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Inconsistent data extraction and aggregation leading to unreliable pooled estimates.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Exclusion of vaccines and antivirals from the study","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"No language restrictions applied to study search","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Use of outdated search databases up to november 2006","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Privacy concerns and surveillance societies related to big data analytics","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Inability of urban big data to capture underlying cause-effect relationships","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Need for understanding human behavior at individual and collective levels","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"}]}
